markdownRemark.html:
Retro Look Pro on Asset Store

Unity provides 3 Render Pipelines with different capabilities. Retro Look Pro supports all 3 render pipelines.

Inside "Assets\LimitlessUnityDevelopment" folder you can find 3 unity packages.

  1. “Universal Renderer Retro Look Pro.unitypackage” for Universal Render.
  2. “High Definition Render Retro Look Pro.unitypackage” for High Definition Render Pipeline.
  3. “Built-in Render Retro Look Pro.unitypackage” for Built-In Render Pipeline.

Import package according to your Render Pipeline.

After importing package please follow the instructions for your Render Pipeline.

  • URP

  • HDRP

  • Built-In

URP

URP Setup

Setup Effects

  1. Go to Tools/Retro Look Pro Setup Tool.
  2. Click the "Add" button. All Retro Look Pro Render Features will be added automatically to your current renderer.
  3. In your scene, add a Volume component to any GameObject you want. In the Volume component, create a new volume profile or use an existing one. Click "Override" and select the Retro Look Pro effect.
  4. You can find example presets in Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/Retro Look Pro URP/Example Scenes/Resources/ExamplePresets.

Alternative Setup

  1. Open your renderer and click "Add Render Feature".
  2. Add the Retro Look Pro effect that you want to use in your project.
  3. In your scene, add a Volume component to any GameObject. In the Volume component, create a new volume profile or use an existing one. Click "Override" and select the Retro Look Pro effect.
  4. Example presets can be found in Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/Retro Look Pro URP/Example Scenes/Resources/ExamplePresets.

Setup Example Scenes

  1. Open your Universal Render Pipeline Asset.
  2. Select the Renderer List field and choose RLPro_ForwardRenderer.

Color Palette

IMPORTANT: To use presets, open Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/RetroLookPro/Resources/ColormapPresets.unitypackage and import it. Then fill RetroLookProColorPaletePresetsList/presetslist with all presets from Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/RetroLookPro/Resources/Colormap Presets.

To use the Colormap Palette effect, insert the blue_noise texture into the bluenoise field. More blue noise textures can be found in Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/RetroLookPro/Resources/Noise Textures/Dither noise textures.

Tape Rewind Example Scene

This scene shows how you can combine and manipulate effects to achieve the needed look. Effects like Bleed, Analog TV Noise, and TV effects are combined with the new VHS Tape Rewind effect.

In the Retro Look Pro Camera GameObject, you can find the CameraExampleAutoController script, which moves the camera back and forth. When the camera moves back, it enables the effects.

Retro Look Pro Example Scene UI

In this example scene, you will see how to use Retro Look Pro for UI elements or any other separate layers.

How it works:

  1. Add the Custom Texture_RLPRO Render feature to your Renderer.
  2. Create a Canvas with UI elements on the UI layer.
  3. Create a Render Texture and switch Anti-aliasing to "2 Samples".
  4. Create a separate camera to render the image to the Render Texture. Insert the previously created Render Texture into the "output texture" field.
  5. Change the background type to "Color" (Solid Black).
  6. Change the Volume Mask to any layer (e.g., UI).
  7. Create a Post Process Volume to apply effects to the UI elements (set the Volume layer to UI).
  8. Create the main Post Process Volume.
  9. In the Main Volume, click "Add Override" and select RetroLookPro/CustomTexture.
  10. Insert the previously created Render Texture in the "Texture" field.
  11. To change the render texture resolution to match your current resolution automatically, click "Add Component" and select Render Texture Auto Resolution. Insert the previously created Render Texture in the "Texture" field.
  12. All done! Now you can see your UI elements with effects rendered separately from other elements in the scene.

Notice: Ensure the order of Retro Look Pro render features in your renderer. If you want a separate layer to be rendered on top of other layers, make sure the Custom Texture_RLPRO render feature is at the bottom of the list.

HDRP

HDRP Setup

To set up Retro Look Pro effects for HDRP:

  1. Go to Edit > Project Settings and select the HDRP Default Settings tab.
  2. Scroll down until you find the "Custom Post Process Orders" section.
  3. Add Retro Look Pro effects to the "After Post Process" list so that HDRP can render them.
  4. Customize the order of your post-processing effects to achieve the desired look.
  5. To use effects in your Post-processing volume, go to Add Override/Post-processing/RetroLookPro and select the effect you want.

Effects Ordering for Example Scenes:

  • Glitch1
  • Glitch2
  • Glitch3
  • PictureCorrection_RLPRO
  • Negative_RLPRO
  • Noise2_RLPRO
  • Noise_RLPRO
  • Phosphor_RLPRO
  • Jitter_RLPRO
  • VHSScanlines_RLPRO
  • AnalogTVNoise_RLPRO
  • EdgeNoise_RLPRO
  • EdgeStretch_RLPRO
  • UltimateVignette_RLPRO
  • PulsatingVignette_RLPRO
  • Fisheye_RLPRO
  • RLProVHSRewind
  • VHS_RLPRO
  • TV_RLPRO
  • OldFilm_RLPRO
  • OldFilm2_RLPRO
  • CRTAperture_RLPRO
  • NTSCEncode_RLPRO
  • ColormapPalette_RLPRO
  • Warp_RLPRO
  • LowRes_RLPRO
  • Bleed_RLPRO
  • Artefacts_RLPRO
  • CinematicBars_RLPRO
  • CustomTexture_RLPRO

You can find example presets in the HDRP Retro Look Pro/Resources/Example Presets folder.

Built-In

Built-In Setup

Setup Effects for Post-processing Stack:

  1. Import the Post Processing package from the Unity Package Manager.
  2. Import Retro Look Pro from the Asset Store or Package Manager.
  3. Import the Built-in Retro Look Pro.unitypackage.
  4. In the Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/Built-In Retro Look Pro/Example Scenes folder, you can find example scenes.
  5. To set up Unity's Post Processing Stack in your scene, follow this guide: Post Processing Stack Setup.
  6. In the post-process volume/profile, click Add Effect/Retro Look Pro and select the effect you need.

Example post-processing presets are available in the Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/Built-In Retro Look Pro/Example Scenes/Resources folder.

Color Palette Setup

To use color palette presets, follow these steps:

  1. Open the file Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/RetroLookPro/Resources/ColormapPresets.unitypackage and import it.
  2. Fill RetroLookProColorPaletePresetsList/presetslist with all presets from Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/RetroLookPro/Resources/Colormap Presets.
  3. Insert the blue_noise texture into the bluenoise field.
  4. More blue noise textures are available in the Assets/LimitlessUnityDevelopment/RetroLookPro/Resources/Noise Textures/Dither noise textures folder.
